properties.Name: StatementOfComprehensiveIncome

Columns.Name: LegalEntityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Legal Entity.

Columns.Name: FinancialStatementId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Financial Statement.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the financial statement is prepared.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the financial statement is prepared.

Columns.Name: Revenue
Columns.Description: The revenue of the organization during the period.

Columns.Name: CostOfSales
Columns.Description: The cost of sales during the period.

Columns.Name: GrossProfit
Columns.Description: The gross profit during the period.

Columns.Name: InvestmentIncome
Columns.Description: The amount of investment income earned during the period.

Columns.Name: OtherGainsAndLosses
Columns.Description: Other gains and losses that occurred during the period.

Columns.Name: DepreciationExpenses
Columns.Description: The amount of depreciation realized during the period.

Columns.Name: DistributionExpenses
Columns.Description: The amount of distribution expenses incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: MarketingExpenses
Columns.Description: The amount of marketing expenses incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: AdministrativeExpenses
Columns.Description: The amount of administrative expenses that occurred during the period.

Columns.Name: OtherExpenses
Columns.Description: The amount of other expenses that occurred during the period.

Columns.Name: FinanceCosts
Columns.Description: The amount of finance costs incurred during the period.

Columns.Name: ShareOfProfitsOfAssociates
Columns.Description: The profits of associated that were shared by the organization during the period.

Columns.Name: GainRecognizedOnDisposalOfInterestInFormerAssociate
Columns.Description: The Gain Recognized on Disposal of Interest in Former Associate

Columns.Name: ProfitBeforeTax
Columns.Description: The profit before tax for the period.

Columns.Name: IncomeTaxExpense
Columns.Description: The income tax expense incurred for the period.

Columns.Name: ProfitForThePeriodFromContinuingOperations
Columns.Description: The profit for the period from continuing operations.

Columns.Name: ProfitForThePeriodFromDiscontinuedOperations
Columns.Description: The profit for the period from discontinued operations.

Columns.Name: ProfitForThePeriod
Columns.Description: The Total Profit for the period.

Columns.Name: ExchangeDifferencesOnTranslatingForeignOperations
Columns.Description: Exchange Differences on Translating Foreign Operations

Columns.Name: GainOnRevaluationOfProperties
Columns.Description: Gain on Revaluation of Properties

Columns.Name: ShareOfComprehensiveIncomeOfAssociates
Columns.Description: Share of Comprehensive Income of Associates

Columns.Name: OtherComprehensiveIncomeForPeriodNetOfTax
Columns.Description: Other Comprehensive Income for Period, Net of Tax

Columns.Name: TotalComprehensiveIncomeForThePeriod
Columns.Description: TOTAL COMPREHENSIVE INCOME FOR THE PERIOD

Columns.Name: ProfitAttributableToOwnersOfTheCompany
Columns.Description: Profit Attributable to Owners of the Company

Columns.Name: ProfitAttributableToNonControllingInterests
Columns.Description: Profit Attributable to Non-controlling Interests

Columns.Name: TotalComprehensiveIncomeAttributableToOwnersOfTheCompany
Columns.Description: Total Comprehensive Income Attributable to Owners of the Company

Columns.Name: TotalComprehensiveIncomeAttributableToNonControllingInterests
Columns.Description: Total Comprehensive Income Attributable to Non-controlling Interests

Columns.Name: BasicFromContinuingOperations
Columns.Description: The Basic Earnings Per Share from continuing operations

Columns.Name: DilutedFromContinuingOperations
Columns.Description: The Diluted Earnings Per Share from continuing operations

Columns.Name: EarningsPerShareLevelOfPrecisionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Level of Precision.

Properties.Description:
The Statement of Comprehensive Income details the amount of income and how it was earned. 

It is a summary of the revenue, expenses and net income/net loss of the legal entity for a specific period where:

REVENUE = The increase in capital as a result of the sale of goods or services provided by the business.   The revenue is equal to the cash, accounts receivable and other assets gained in compensation for goods sold or services rendered.

EXPENSES = The decrease in capital that is the result of the business' revenue-producing operations.   The expenses amount is equal to the value of the goods and services used up or consumed in obtaining the revenue.

NET INCOME = The increase in capital that is the result from profitable operation of the business during the period.   It is the excess of revenues over expenses for the accounting period.

NET LOSS = The decrease in capital resulting from the operations of the business.   It is the excess of expenses over revenue for the operating period.

It is a record of its earnings or losses for a given period. It shows all of the money a company earned (revenues) and all of the money a company spent (expenses) during this period. 

It documents the changes in the balance sheet retained earnings account from one period to the next (see Stockholders Equity Retained Earnings).

It also accounts for the effects of some basic accounting principles such as depreciation.

It is for a specific period of time, where the balance sheet is at a specific instance of time.

properties.Description:
The Statement of Comprehensive Income details the amount of income and how it was earned. 

It is a summary of the revenue, expenses and net income/net loss of the legal entity for a specific period where:

REVENUE = The increase in capital as a result of the sale of goods or services provided by the business.   The revenue is equal to the cash, accounts receivable and other assets gained in compensation for goods sold or services rendered.

EXPENSES = The decrease in capital that is the result of the business' revenue-producing operations.   The expenses amount is equal to the value of the goods and services used up or consumed in obtaining the revenue.

NET INCOME = The increase in capital that is the result from profitable operation of the business during the period.   It is the excess of revenues over expenses for the accounting period.

NET LOSS = The decrease in capital resulting from the operations of the business.   It is the excess of expenses over revenue for the operating period.

It is a record of its earnings or losses for a given period. It shows all of the money a company earned (revenues) and all of the money a company spent (expenses) during this period. 

It documents the changes in the balance sheet retained earnings account from one period to the next (see Stockholders Equity Retained Earnings).

It also accounts for the effects of some basic accounting principles such as depreciation.

It is for a specific period of time, where the balance sheet is at a specific instance of time.
